sections.instructions:
i) This section consists of 18 part questions and all are to be answered. Each question carries ½ mark.
ii) Do not copy the part questions in your answerbook. Write only the answer in full against the proper number of the question and its part.

questions.question: An injury sustained by the hypothalamus is most likely to interrupt:
Even after the brain of a frog has been crushed, it still responds to a pinch on the leg by drawing it away. This act is an example of:
In humans, Parkinson's disease is linked with the deficiency of:
All of the following are hormones of the anterior pituitary except:
The following hormones are responsible for the 'fight-or-flight' response:
A characteristic of territorial behavior in animals:
The following is an example of a learned behavior in animals:

options.C: Goose flying south for the winter

questions.question: This is an example of innate behavior:

options.A: A dog learning to sit on command
options.D: A fish learning to swim in a tank

questions.question: The correct sequence of cell stage in spermatogenesis is:
The decreased level of this hormone causes menstruation:
The period of rapid physical and sexual maturation during adolescence is called:
This disorder is characterized by the presence of an extra X chromosome in females, resulting in infertility and developmental abnormalities:
Aging is characterized by:

options.A: Increase in the consumption of oxygen
options.D: A decrease in the metabolic activity

questions.question: The only treatment in case of uremia is:
Apart from the conventional use, Dialysis can also be used in scenarios of:
Immunosuppressant drugs are consumed with:
This is correct for muscle contraction:

options.B: Shortening of A, H and I bands

questions.question: Each hipbone is formed by the fusion of three bones Pubis, Ilium and:

sections.instructions: Attempt any NINE part questions in all. Select FIVE Reasoning Questions and FOUR Non-Reasoning Questions. All part questions carry equal marks.

questions.question: How do neurotransmitters work as inhibitory and excitatory signals? Write some common examples of these neurotransmitters.
Why does excess use of dairy products, meats, and green-leaf vegetables cause kidney stones? Mention the methods for treatment of kidney stones.
Why is saltatory conduction the fastest?
How do aquatic osmoregulators overcome the osmoregulatory problems?
Why the hormonal system of the female is better than the male?
How do bees communicate about food resources?
How do embryonic tissues influence other embryonic tissues?
How is tetany different from tetanus, while both show some common symptoms
Mention the role of kidney as an endocrine gland.
Define biological rhythm. Mention that biological rhythm is important for man.
Define Receptors. State the gustatory receptors with their functions.
Explain the principal reproductive hormones of human male and explain their role in the maintenance and functioning of the reproductive system.
Mention the injuries in joints (dislocation and sprain) and their first aid treatment.
List some changes that occur in the system and those that occur at the cellular level during aging.
Write a note on taxis. Mention their types with examples.

sections.instructions: Attempt any TWO question from this section. All questions carry equal marks. Draw labeled diagrams where necessary.

questions.question: Explain the resting membrane potential, depolarization, action potential, synapse, and repolarization. —OR— Define skeletal muscle? Describe the mechanism of contraction of skeletal muscle with the help of diagrams.
Explain the regulatory functions of the nephron with the help of a labelled diagram —OR— Explain habituation, imprinting, classic conditioning, and insight learning.
Describe the maternal-derived abnormalities (Rubella, Abnormal neural tube, Thyroid dysfunction, limb development issues).
